title: (x) Gossiping Bitches.com - Baskerville Old face, Chopin {William, Mike E}
content:
Included pictures this time... ![logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/29331.jpg) ![deck](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/29332.jpg)   
   
thanks in advance..
author: rjhunter

comments.content: It could be [Baskerville Old Face](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/baskerville-old-face/baskerville-old-face/testdrive.html?s=gossiping%2Bbitches&p=72), maybe outlined and condensed.
Awesome.. I knew it would be fast ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
Yeah, i saw.. Depressing.. I thought I was addicted to heroin or something trying to refresh ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Eduardo's were close enough for me ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) thanks Yves. Tech gliches are a bitch, but well worth the wait for this site ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Well, you probably don't care any more, Rob, but I know that the forum   
participants are gnashing their teeth, desirous of knowing the identity   
of that grungy script. Or maybe not ...   
   
It seems to have begun its life as a version of a typeface that appears   
in the Solotype Catalog as Chopin. Dieter Steffmann digitized it as   
 [Chopin Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/samples/c/chopin.htm). Here's [another](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nb_ppp=40&texte=News&nq=1&q=chopin) Chopin Script by a 'Diogenes'. And you   
can also find it as [Chase Callas](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149/http:/members.dca.net/pheanix/msie/c5.htm) by the defunct Soft Horizons.   
   
One of these, or yet another version, seems to have begat [Radagund](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nb_ppp=40&texte=News&nq=1&q=radagund),   
 which I believe to be the font used.

I love DaFont ï¿½ even if its owner does have an odd view of what makes   
up Calligraphic Script fonts.
Oh, and who is this "Mike E"? ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050826014149im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/wink.gif)
